Minneapolis.The Minikahda Club:
The Minikahda Club is a golf club and course located in southwest Minneapolis, Minnesota, just west of Lake Calhoun. The course hosted the U.S. Open in 1916, the U.S. Amateur in 1927, and the Walker Cup in 1957.


== History ==
Minikahda was founded in 1898 on the hills above the west shore of Lake Calhoun, the land, purchased from the Oglala Lakota Chief "Swift Dog" who owned the land in which the golf course stands to this day.
